description: When President Donald Trump ordered the deportation of hundreds of alleged Venezuelan gang members on March 14, he did so by invoking a controversial US law that hasn’t been used since World War II.
title: What’s the Alien Enemies Act? Why Did Trump Use It to Deport Venezuelans?

description: President Donald Trump’s administration is mandating federal agencies report how much they spent negotiating labor union contracts for the past year, a sign that collective bargaining agreements could be the next target in a government cost-cutting push.
title: Trump Targets Spending on Labor Union Talks in Latest DOGE Move

description: The UK and European Union will advance talks on how to seize frozen Russian assets to jointly boost defense spending, as they seek ways to increase economic pressure on Vladimir Putin ahead of any peace talks to end his war on Ukraine.
title: UK and EU Advance Talks on Seizing Frozen Russian Assets

description: President Donald Trump has nominated Bryan Bedford, the chief executive officer of regional airline Republic Airways Holdings Inc., to be the next leader of the Federal Aviation Administration.
title: Trump Taps Republic Airways CEO to Lead US Aviation Regulator

description: Canada can only go so far in responding to new levies imposed by US President Donald Trump given the mismatch in size between the economies, Prime Minister Mark Carney said.
title: Canada Is Limited in Matching Further US Tariffs, Carney Says

description: Germany’s top court rejected additional attempts to prevent the nation’s outgoing parliament from making changes to the constitution to remove limits on defense borrowing and set up a €500 billion ($546 billion) infrastructure fund.
title: German Top Court Rejects More Attempts to Stop Debt-Brake Vote

description: New Zealand is ready for some tough negotiations with India as it seeks a free-trade agreement that includes dairy, Prime Minister Christopher Luxon said.
title: New Zealand PM Hasn’t Given Up on Dairy in Trade Deal With India

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Nathan Dean gives his insights into what’s been happening and what’s coming up in the nooks and crannies of government and markets.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Get Ready for the Debt Ceiling Debate Coming This Summer

description: Comments from South Africa’s ambassador about the Trump administration were “unacceptable” and “obscene,” State Department spokeswoman Tammy Bruce said Monday, providing further explanation why the envoy is no longer welcome in Washington.
title: South Africa’s Ambassador Made ‘Unacceptable’ Comments, US Says

description: President Donald Trump cast the Kennedy Center, one of the nation’s premier cultural institutions, as being in a state of disrepair, vowing sweeping changes to the iconic venue’s structure and programming.
title: Trump Says He Never Liked ‘Hamilton’ in Kennedy Center Visit

description: The United States Postal Service is directing the Department of Government Efficiency to review its real estate portfolio and search for fixes to certain legally mandated pension payments and regulatory requirements, according to a letter to lawmakers from Postmaster General Louis DeJoy viewed by Bloomberg.
title: Postal Service Letter to Congress Details DOGE’s To-Do List

description: President Donald Trump said Chinese leader Xi Jinping would visit Washington soon amid brewing trade tensions between the world’s two largest economies.
title: Trump Says Xi Will Visit Washington in Not Too Distant Future

description: Lithuanian Foreign Minister Kęstutis Budrys said he hopes US President Donald Trump will tell Vladimir Putin to accept the ceasefire proposal that Ukraine has backed, and warns it would be “damaging to even consider” restoring relations with Russia now.
title: Trump Should Tell Putin to Take Ukraine Deal, Minister Says

description: Venezuela will do “whatever it takes” to free hundreds of its citizens deported by the US to a notorious prison in El Salvador, according to National Assembly leader Jorge Rodríguez.
title: Venezuela Pledges to Free Citizens Deported to El Salvador Jail

description: President Donald Trump’s weekend shutdown of the US Agency for Global Media has among its casualties a small — but influential — fund that helps internet users worldwide combat censorship from oppressive regimes.
title: Trump Order Gutting Agencies Cuts Tools to Fight Censorship Worldwide

description: German plans for a debt-financed splurge on defense and infrastructure remained on track for parliamentary approval on Tuesday after conservative and Social Democrat lawmakers signaled overwhelming support for the spending bill.
title: German Party Heads See Support for Finance Package Before Vote

description: President Donald Trump’s top trade negotiator is attempting to inject order into sweeping new tariffs expected next month, after previous announcements roiled markets and fueled business uncertainty.
title: Trump Trade Chief Pushes for Order After Rocky Tariff Rollout

description: Texas will close a centralized booking facility near its border with Mexico, the latest signal from the state that part of its massive border security apparatus may no longer be necessary.
title: Texas to Shutter Booking Facility as Border Arrests Dwindle

description: Thousands of people gathered in cities across North Macedonia, demanding justice after a nightclub fire on Saturday claimed the lives of at least 59 people.
title: Thousands Rally in North Macedonia After Fatal Nightclub Blaze

description: The Trump administration unveiled plans to build housing on federal land, a move it said could help address a shortfall of 7 million affordable homes in the US.
title: Trump Team Unveils Plans to Build Housing on Federal Land

description: One of the top contenders to become Canada’s next prime minister has promised to scrap the country’s industrial carbon tax.
title: Conservatives Promise to Kill Canada’s Industrial Carbon Tax

description: Mozambique’s most prominent opposition leader Venâncio Mondlane called for a nationwide shutdown on Tuesday to commemorate the country’s “true heroes,” including hundreds of protesters who have died in unrest following October elections.
title: Mozambique Opposition Head Calls for a Day of National Shutdown

description: President Donald Trump ratcheted up pressure on Iran to rein in the Houthis, raising the possibility of retaliatory strikes against the Islamic Republic if the militant group in Yemen doesn’t stop its attacks.
title: Trump Ramps Up Pressure on Iran With Fresh Houthi Threats

description: European Union member states made progress toward a fresh military aid package for Ukraine worth up to €40 billion ($43.7 billion), just days ahead of a leaders’ summit later this week.
title: EU Progressing on €40 Billion Military Aid Plan for Kyiv

description: The US Federal Trade Commission is gearing up for a trial next month to break up Meta Platforms Inc. and has the resources it needs to police the deep-pocketed tech sector despite a government-wide cost slashing effort, according to agency Chairman Andrew Ferguson.
title: FTC Has the Resources to Take On Big Tech, Chairman Says

description: Slovak authorities charged a 72-year-old retiree who is accused of shooting Prime Minister Robert Fico at close range last year with carrying out a terrorist attack.
title: Fico Suspect Charged With Terrorist Attack by Slovak Prosecutors

description: La desaparición de la agencia pone fin a la promoción de ideales estadounidenses, por incómodos que fueran. Regímenes autoritarios están aprovechando el momento.
title: Prensa libre y derechos humanos, víctimas de la caída de USAID

description: Peruvian authorities are planning to declare a state of emergency and deploy the military to combat crime in the capital of Lima, after a singer’s murder again raised alarm about extortion rackets.
title: Peru to Declare State of Emergency in Lima After Singer’s Murder

description: China is ramping up pressure on Taiwan with the People’s Liberation Army increasing flights across the US-drawn boundary separating the mainland from the self-ruled island.
title: China Signals New Military Drills Near Taiwan Are Response to US

description: Gavin Newsom is talking to MAGA darlings. Wes Moore is helping fired federal workers find new jobs. Gretchen Whitmer is meeting with the president to talk about tariffs.
title: Beleaguered Democrats Eye 2028 With Podcasts, Red-State Rallies

description: Border police representing Bosnia-Herzegovina’s central authorities issued an arrest warrant for Milorad Dodik, the leader of the nation’s Serb entity, according to the Oslobodjenje newspaper.
title: Bosnia Police Issues Arrest Warrant for Dodik, Oslobodjenje Says

description: Senate Democratic leader Chuck Schumer postponed a book tour scheduled for this week amid a backlash over his decision to end a blockade against a Republican spending plan to avert a shutdown.
title: Schumer Postpones Book Tour Amid Backlash on Shutdown Stance

description: Lithuanian prosecutors accused Russia’s military intelligence of recruiting individuals to carry out an arson attack on an Ikea store in the Baltic country’s capital last year.
title: Lithuania Says Russian Intelligence Behind Ikea Arson Attack

description: President Donald Trump’s administration is being accused of defying the judiciary after swiftly deporting hundreds of alleged Venezuelan gang members in an assertion of sweeping power to pursue hard-line immigration policies.
title: Trump’s Deportation Push Tests Courts’ Ability to Check His Power

description: Nigel Farage unveiled 29 new councilors — including more than a dozen Conservative defectors — who have joined Reform UK, as a new survey highlighted how his party is gaining traction among Britain’s voters.
title: Reform UK Lures 29 Defecting Councilors as Farage Gains Ground

description: Rachel Reeves has defended her fiscal rules and pledged to bring down government borrowing, as the UK Chancellor of the Exchequer faces dissent from Labour party colleagues opposed to cuts to welfare payments and government spending.
title: Reeves Pledges to Get a Grip on UK Debt as Welfare Split Grows

description: President Vladimir Putin allowed some international funds including American ones to sell Russian securities, a day before planned talks with President Donald Trump on a possible ceasefire in the war on Ukraine.
title: Putin Allows Some Western Funds to Sell Russian Securities

description: Mark Carney used his first international trip as Canada’s prime minister to pitch a closer alliance with European allies as the country aims to reduce its dependence on an increasingly antagonistic US.
title: Carney Tries to Pull France, UK Closer With More Tariffs Coming From Trump

description: China will help increase capacity at two solar projects in Kuwait, further boosting ties after the two countries agreed to develop a long-delayed strategic port.
title: China Tightens Ties to Kuwait With Deal to Expand Solar Power

description: Nigel Farage’s Reform UK has won over voters from the Labour Party since last year’s general election, according to a new survey that highlights the government’s fraying popularity.
title: One in Five Labour Voters Mull Switch to Reform UK, Poll Finds

description: Taiwan expects President Donald Trump’s administration to continue to support it — along with supplies of US weaponry — in case of hostilities with China, a senior Taiwanese official said Monday.
title: Taiwan Expects US Support in China Hostilities, Official Says

description: The government of Rwanda notified Belgium of its decision to sever diplomatic relations, effective immediately, according to a statement posted on X by the African nation’s Department of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation.
title: Rwanda Severs Diplomatic Relations With Belgium

description: The Kremlin confirmed that Russian President Vladimir Putin is due to speak to President Donald Trump on Tuesday amid the US push for a ceasefire in the war in Ukraine.
title: Kremlin Says Putin to Speak to Trump as US Pushes Ukraine Truce

description: The US wants countries impacted by trade disruptions from Houthi attacks in the Red Sea to take action against the militia after US President Donald Trump ordered military strikes against the group, a top US intelligence official said.
title: Gabbard Says US Wants Other Nations to Act Against Houthis Too

description: The marketing slogan is supposed to alter consumer habits and bolster domestic manufacturing, but its long history reveals darker motivations.
title: The Real Reason Trump Is Pushing ‘Buy American’

description: I’m Malcolm Scott, international economics enterprise editor in Sydney. Today we’re looking at how China’s improving economic and market outlook contrasts with growing uncertainty over the US policy path. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net or get in touch on X via @economics. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.
title: Xi ‘Put’ Underpins China Story as US Exceptionalism Falters

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Hitting the Houthis Ups Mideast Stakes for Trump

description: US President Donald Trump’s aggressive trade policies have abruptly set the world onto a path of slower growth and higher inflation that could worsen notably if tensions escalate, the OECD said.
title: Trump’s Trade Wars Tip World to Slower Growth, Faster Inflation

description: The demise of the US Agency for International Development is sapping billions of dollars of funding for health and social programs that will be difficult for the world to replace. But it’s also leaving behind a complicated legacy as a promoter of American values abroad.
title: USAID Cuts Imperil Free Press, Human-Rights Advocacy in Autocracies

description: Romanian far-right candidate George Simion would likely win the first round of the May presidential election, but lose in a runoff, according to the first poll released after a pro-Russia frontrunner was barred from the race.
title: Romanian Far Right Would Lose Presidential Runoff, Poll Shows

description: MAGA M&A?
title: FTC Chief Andrew Ferguson on the Trump Vision for Antitrust

description: US President Donald Trump said his predecessor’s 11th-hour pardons of members of Congress who investigated the January 6 insurrection were “void, vacant and of no further force or effect,” signaling his administration may attempt to upend more than a century of law and practice for presidential pardons.
title: Trump Calls Biden Pardons ‘Void’ Because of Autopen Usage

description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth has pushed back a Seoul visit he has been eyeing for as early as this month as political uncertainty continues in South Korea after President Yoon Suk Yeol’s shock martial law declaration.
title: Hegseth Skips South Korea Visit as Leadership Vacuum Takes Toll

description: Irish government mounts a St. Patrick’s Day diplomatic offensive to try and calm Trump anger at ‘massive’ trade surplus.
title: Ireland’s Profits From Weight-Loss Drugs Draw Trump’s Attention

description: Spain’s economy is getting a boost thanks to the country’s attractiveness for remote workers, according to central bank chief Jose Luis Escriva.
title: Spain’s Lure for Digital Nomads Is Boosting the Economy, Central Bank Chief Says

description: President Donald Trump said he would be imposing both broad reciprocal tariffs and additional sector-specific tariffs on April 2.
title: Trump Says Both Reciprocal and Sectoral Tariffs Coming April 2

description: President Donald Trump said he’ll speak with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday, as the US continues to push for an end to fighting in Russia’s three-year war in Ukraine.
title: Trump to Speak With Putin Tuesday in Push for Ukraine Ceasefire

description: Global CEOs including Qualcomm Inc.’s Cristiano Amon and Saudi Aramco’s Amin Nasser will travel to Beijing for an annual gathering of top executives, people familiar with the matter say, with some expected to meet top leaders like President Xi Jinping.
title: China Plans for Global CEOs to Meet Xi in Beijing Next Week

description: South Korea’s semiconductor exports to China plunged last month, deepening concerns about a cooling in global demand already threatened by US tariffs, as Washington steps up its restrictions on technology supplies to Beijing.
title: South Korea’s Chip Exports to China Sink as US Controls Tighten

description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi lavished praise on Donald Trump as a man of courage, underscoring strong personal bonds now being tested by the US president’s tariff plans, which also include the South Asian nation.
title: Modi Praises Ties With Trump That Are Now Being Tested by Tariff Threats

description: Support for Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba plunged after he admitted handing out shopping vouchers worth hundreds of dollars to newly-elected lawmakers, enfeebling a minority government that was already struggling to pass the budget ahead of elections this summer.
title: Japanese PM Ishiba’s Support Plunges Over Handout to Lawmakers

description: The Democratic Action Party, which has the most parliamentary seats in the ruling coalition, hopes the government will amend the federal constitution to restrict prime ministers to a maximum 10 years in office, the Malay Mail reported.
title: Anwar Coalition Partner Wants 10-Year Limits for PMs: Malay Mail

description: More than half a million UK home buyers are trying to tie up deals before a tax break slams shut at the start of April, according to property website Rightmove.
title: Half a Million UK Homebuyers Rush to Beat Tax Rise, Survey Says

description: The UK government will abolish more business regulators and scale back welfare spending to drive stagnant economic growth.
title: UK Axes Regulators, Targets Welfare in Economic Growth Drive

description: The British government should take immediate steps to determine what’s driving an explosion of worker visas, an official watchdog said, highlighting a lack of oversight for a program at the center of the country’s contentious migration debate.
title: UK Must Try to Understand Migrant Worker Surge, Watchdog Says
